official-title.#text:
To amend the Migratory Bird Treaty Act to exempt certain Alaskan Native articles from prohibitions
			 against sale of items containing nonedible migratory bird parts, and for
			 other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 2 of the Migratory Bird Treaty Act

header.#text: Exemption from prohibitions for Alaskan Native articles containing migratory bird parts
Exemption for authentic Alaskan Native articles of handicraft or clothing

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Act, nothing in this Act prohibits possession,
			 offering for sale, sale, offering to barter, barter, offering to purchase,
			 purchase, delivery for shipment, shipment, causing to be shipped,
			 delivered for transportation, transport or causing to be transported,
			 carrying or causing to be carried, or receiving for shipment,
			 transportation, or carriage, any authentic Alaskan Native article of
			 handicraft or clothing on the basis that it contains a nonedible migratory
			 bird part.

This subsection shall not apply with respect to any handicraft or clothing containing any part of a
			 migratory bird that was taken in a wasteful manner.

term.#tail: means any Indian, Aleut, or Eskimo who resides in Alaska.

text.#text: composed wholly or in some significant respect of natural materials; and

produced, decorated, or fashioned by an Alaskan Native, in the exercise of traditional Alaskan
			 Native handicrafts, without the use of any pantograph or other mass
			 copying device; and

includes any weaving, carving, stitching, sewing, lacing, beading, drawing, or painting described
			 in clause (i), or any combination thereof.

header.#text: Authentic Alaskan Native article of handicraft or clothing

term.#text: authentic Alaskan Native article of handicraft or clothing
